intro: Draba asprella var. asprella, commonly known as the alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its small, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. It produces small, elongated seed pods that release tiny seeds when mature. Draba asprella var. asprella is a hardy perennial that is often found in high-altitude environments, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
